page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Until 50 years ago Glengormley was just a tiny village. It was really a place where roads from Hightown, Antrim, Ballyclare, Carnmoney (Hill Area) and Carnmoney Lower (Church Road) areas met. Its real importance was as a watering place for farmers going and coming from Market in Belfast and for people coming to drink outside Belfast City Boundry (on Sundays). An early Bellevue Zoo was sited where Glengormley Primary School is now. This School and Church are celebrating their 50th anniversary in 1985. Carnmoney Village about 1 mile away was a much more important centre. Very important as an employer about 40 years ago was the Old Whitewell Laundry which previously was a print works, and is found just outside our
